bibl.title: The Early Islamic Period (641-1517). From the Arab Conquest through Mamlūk Rule.
The Coptic Christian Heritage. History, Faith, and Culture.

bibl.note: Early Islamic Rule (641-61). - Umayyad Dynasty (661-750). - ‘Abbasid Rule (750-1258). - Fāṭimids (969-1171). - Ayyūbids (1171-1250). - Mamlūks (1250-1517). - Selected Bibliography.
bibl.seg: Maged S.A. Mikhail, The Early Islamic Period (641-1517). From the Arab Conquest through Mamlūk Rule.
Lois M. Farag (ed.), The Coptic Christian Heritage. History, Faith, and Culture (Abingdon - New York, 2014) pp. 39-53.
Early Islamic Rule (641-61). - Umayyad Dynasty (661-750). - ‘Abbasid Rule (750-1258). - Fāṭimids (969-1171). - Ayyūbids (1171-1250). - Mamlūks (1250-1517). - Selected Bibliography.
